intro: Pycnostelma, commonly known as the "bushy bellflower," is a genus of flowering plants native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its dense, bushy growth habit and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plants typically have opposite, ovate leaves and produce small, clustered inflorescences. Pycnostelma species are often found in rocky or sandy soils and are adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. They are valued in horticulture for their ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in well-drained conditions.
